passport_new.title: New Ordinary Passport Registration
criteria: Must possess a valid Nepali Citizenship Certificate.
Minors under 16 require a minor identity card and parents' citizenship.
required_documents: Valid National Identity (NID) Number (mandatory for applicants in Nepal).
process: Step 1: Complete the online Pre-enrollment for Passport.
Step 2: Book an appointment date at the District Administration Office (DAO) or Passport Department.
Step 3: Visit the office for live biometrics (photo, fingerprints, signature).
Step 4: Pay the designated fee and track the application via SMS/Online.

passport_lost_stolen_damaged.title: Lost, Stolen, or Damaged Passport Replacement
required_documents: Police Report (stating the loss/theft of the passport).
Copy of the lost passport (if available).
Application letter explaining the reason for damage or loss.

additional_fees.In_Nepal: Additional NPR 5,000 on top of the regular fee.
additional_fees.At_Missions_Abroad: 50% extra on top of the regular mission fee.

process: Step 1: Obtain a police report immediately after the loss.
Step 2: Apply for a new passport under the 'Lost/Damaged' category.
Step 3: Pay the standard fee plus the 'Lost/Damaged' penalty fee.

foreign_employment_workers.desc: Workers whose passport validity is less than their approved labor contract period can apply for a new passport.
foreign_employment_workers.requirement: Proof of approved foreign employment period.

students_abroad.desc: Students whose passport validity is less than their study duration can apply for a new passport.
students_abroad.requirement: Proof of higher education duration abroad.

emergency_travel_document.desc: A 'Travel Document' or 'Temporary Passport' can be issued for emergency one-way travel to Nepal.
